thread.title: Redskins want to opt out of Color Rush uniforms for one simple reason
thread.title_full: Redskins want to opt out of Color Rush uniforms for one simple reason

title: Redskins want to opt out of Color Rush uniforms for one simple reason
text:
Mar 23, 2017 at 8:32p ET 0Shares 
The NFL’s Color Rush jerseys have been a love-it-or-hate-it concept since they became mandatory last season. 
There were obvious hits … 
— russel chillson (@infinitevaldezz) January 6, 2017 Monday open thread: Should the #DetroitLions wear their color rush jerseys in 2017? https://t.co/CHNOhuyEMf pic.twitter.com/bZhfEf22Tp 
— Zesty Lions News (@zesty_lions) January 31, 2017 
And misses … 
— Titans Coupons (@CouponsTitans) January 26, 2017 GQMagazine: The Dolphins' color rush uniforms are shockingly, offensively orange https://t.co/tMbeKScdqT pic.twitter.com/kjCr3ioVc1 
— Auxilry (@Auxilry) September 30, 2016 
But it looks like one team doesn’t want any part of the short-lived tradition. Among the 2017 NFL rules proposals announced Thursday , the Washington Redskins want to allow teams to opt out of the Color Rush uniforms and offered this two-word reason – garish uniforms. 
Ironically, the Redskins – along with the Colts and Lions – didn’t have to wear the jerseys last season because their only Thursday game was on Thanksgiving afternoon – allowing them to sidestep the rule that requires teams to wear Color Rush uniforms during Thursday night games. 
Judging by the look of the Redskins version, we see why they want no part of the concept. Redskins given all-yellow ‘Color Rush’ uniforms, but won’t wear them: https://t.co/6Hc1cWCjnZ pic.twitter.com/2iYICs4NJr
